profile.name: Roman Roy
profile.headline: Media executive with instinctive understanding of content, audience psychology, and digital consumer behavior. Known for unconventional strategic insights that more analytical leaders miss.
profile.executiveSummary: Youngest Roy sibling who rose through Waystar Royco's entertainment and digital divisions, bringing an intuitive grasp of audience psychology and content strategy that contrasts with the company's traditional analytical approach. Successfully managed international partner relationships including the complex GoJo/Matsson negotiation. Known for irreverent communication style that masks sharp strategic instincts and surprising emotional intelligence in one-on-one settings.

evidence.outcome: Identified content gaps in Waystar entertainment portfolio before analytics confirmed them
evidence.description: Applied intuitive understanding of audience psychology to spot programming weaknesses others missed

evidence.outcome: Championed digital-first content initiative that drove 40% increase in younger demographic engagement
evidence.description: Advocated for content format and distribution changes targeting underserved audience segments

evidence.outcome: Repositioned Brightstar Parks brand driving 15% attendance increase in first year
evidence.description: Directed brand refresh including visual identity, messaging, and experiential design

evidence.outcome: Developed brand architecture strategy for Waystar's consumer-facing properties
evidence.description: Created framework defining brand relationships across ATN, Brightstar, and entertainment divisions

evidence.outcome: Managed relationship with Lukas Matsson during GoJo merger negotiations
evidence.description: Built personal rapport with GoJo CEO facilitating deal progression when formal negotiations stalled

evidence.outcome: Explored expansion opportunities across 5 Asian markets for Waystar entertainment properties
evidence.description: Evaluated market entry strategies including joint ventures, licensing, and direct investment

evidence.outcome: Developed digital engagement strategy achieving 25% year-over-year audience growth
evidence.description: Created multi-platform content distribution approach leveraging social media, streaming, and interactive formats

evidence.outcome: Managed Waystar's theme park and entertainment division operations
evidence.description: Oversaw Brightstar Parks operational improvements including guest experience enhancement and new attraction development

evidence.outcome: Applied audience behavior insights to inform content commissioning decisions
evidence.description: Translated viewership patterns and engagement data into actionable content development recommendations

evidence.outcome: Maintained productive relationship with difficult international partner through personal diplomacy
evidence.description: Used humor, authenticity, and strategic patience to navigate cultural and personality differences with key partners

evidence.outcome: Drafted investor messaging that resonated with younger institutional analysts
evidence.description: Brought contemporary communication style to traditionally conservative corporate communications

evidence.outcome: Proposed interactive content format that became Waystar's fastest-growing digital product
evidence.description: Identified consumer trend toward interactive and participatory media experiences

evidence.outcome: Directed Waystar social media strategy across 5 platforms reaching 50M+ combined followers
evidence.description: Applied native understanding of social media culture to corporate brand management

evidence.outcome: Tracked competitor content strategies across streaming, social, and broadcast platforms
evidence.description: Monitored Netflix, Disney+, and platform competitor moves to inform Waystar content strategy

evidence.outcome: Negotiated content licensing deals worth $200M+ across international markets
evidence.description: Structured licensing agreements balancing revenue optimization with market development goals

evidence.outcome: Redesigned Brightstar Parks marketing approach increasing digital ticket sales 60%
evidence.description: Shifted marketing spend from traditional channels to social and influencer-driven campaigns

evidence.outcome: Represented Waystar at international media summits and partner negotiations
evidence.description: Despite unconventional style, demonstrated ability to command executive settings when required

evidence.outcome: Identified emerging creative talent for Waystar entertainment properties
evidence.description: Leveraged cultural awareness and industry relationships to source content creators and performers

evidence.outcome: Consistently predicted content performance with higher accuracy than data-driven models
evidence.description: Applied instinctive audience understanding to content evaluation, outperforming analytical approaches in hit prediction

evidence.outcome: Read interpersonal dynamics in Matsson relationship that other executives missed
evidence.description: Identified emotional subtext and personal motivations driving partner behavior, enabling more effective engagement

evidence.outcome: Used humor to defuse tense boardroom situations and build rapport in negotiations
evidence.description: Applied irreverent communication style strategically to create openings in high-pressure corporate settings

evidence.outcome: Transitioned from entertainment focus to COO responsibilities during succession period
evidence.description: Expanded operational scope rapidly when opportunity required broader leadership capability

evidence.outcome: Championed high-risk content investments that outperformed conservative alternatives
evidence.description: Advocated for unconventional content bets that more risk-averse executives would have rejected

evidence.outcome: Predicted shift to short-form content 2 years before TikTok dominated media landscape
evidence.description: Identified emerging consumer preference for bite-sized content formats based on cultural observation

evidence.outcome: Pioneered influencer partnership program for Brightstar Parks generating earned media worth $5M+
evidence.description: Built influencer relationships and created experiential partnerships driving organic social reach

workHistory.title: COO
workHistory.description: Expanded from entertainment division leadership to full COO responsibilities. Managed GoJo merger relationship and represented Waystar in international partnerships.

workHistory.title: President, Entertainment Division
workHistory.description: Led Brightstar Parks, entertainment content, and digital media operations. Drove brand repositioning and digital audience growth strategy.

workHistory.title: VP, Digital Content
workHistory.description: Managed digital content strategy and social media operations. Built digital audience across platforms.

purpose: Everyone wants to be profound. I just want to be right â€” and have a good time getting there.
